The BI Survey 18 Highlights Analyzer

for Product A

Product A Highlights Survey Results (non-product related) Documentation

Product A Highlights

This interactive article is a specially produced summary by BARC of the headline results for Product A. It contains just a selection of the headline findings for Product A. It does not show all the KPI results and focuses mainly on the positive findings for Product A. For more information on the survey, visit The BI Survey website.

Scroll down

BARC comment

This year again Product A underpins its status as a leader in business benefits in three of its peer groups. Customers mainly benefit from faster and more accurate reporting, analysis and planning, which leads to improved data quality, better business decisions and improved employee satisfaction.

Product A has maintained its ranking for business benefits from last year, creating good value for its customers and scoring consistently high ratings in business benefits in The BI Survey. Customers clearly benefit from having a flexible, integrated CPM platform for planning, simulation, strategy implementation (balanced scorecard) and project portfolio management.

BARC comment

Product A has topped the ‘Large enterprise BI platforms’ peer group for mobile BI use for the last seven years. Its score of 8.1/10 is well clear of The BI Survey average of 4.4/10. Product A was one of the first BI and analytics vendors to focus strongly on mobile BI. The vendor introduced a framework for building individual and customized mobile applications.

Not only do these apps serve typical information needs, but many customers have also built operational mobile applications which make use of further platform services such as Transaction Services to write back operational data and therefore support business processes.

BARC comment

Customers are satisfied and vote Product A as the number one for sales/purchasing experience in the ‘Large international BI vendors’ peer group. In particular, the overall rating of product evaluation and contract negotiation, timely and thorough response to product-related and technical questions, general behavior and the ability to understand organizations’ needs are highlighted by customers.

In a highly competitive market like the BI and CPM software market in the Americas region (Product A's home market), a highly professional sales organization is essential for survival and to constantly win new customers.

Product A's Highlight Quotes*

*Interactive Video not included in interactive Highlights Analyzer Web app offering (separate Add-on).

BARC's Summary on Product A's Highlights

Year after year, Product A underpins its status as one of the leading CPM and BI vendors in The BI Survey. The vendor’s flexible, integrated CPM platform for planning, simulation, strategy implementation (balanced scorecard) and project portfolio management clearly seems to satisfy customers.

Outstanding price-performance ratio paired with strong performance, vendor and product satisfaction convinces customers. Customers can greatly benefit from outperform in terms of faster and more accurate reporting, analysis or planning, overall leading to improved data quality, better business decisions and improved employee satisfaction. Many customers acknowledge this fact and prefer using Product A instead of competitor’s products.

The BI Survey Analyzer

Our powerful interactive online tool, enables you to perform your own custom analysis of the survey data. This basic version allows you to analyze the results for each question in The BI Survey and filter results by region, industry, company size etc. The premium version gives you access to all the product-related findings, enabling you to make customized comparisons of the BI products on your shortlist across the whole set of 29 KPIs.

About The BI Survey Highlights Analyzer

The BI Survey Highlights Analyzer web app for Product A is an interactive tool that enables you to perform your own custom analysis of the Highlights of Product A as well as the non-product related BI Survey 18 data. The app contains results from all the questions asked in The BI Survey 18. For more information on The BI Survey methodology see The BI Survey about page and the following table.

Peer Groups
  • Solution-focused planning products
  • BI-focused products
  • Enterprise software vendors
  • Flexible planning platforms
Solution-focused planning products

Solution-focused planning products are usually based on, or supplemented by, predefined planning solutions designed for particular applications (e.g., integrated financial planning, HR) or industries (e.g., energy, manufacturing).

  • BI Office Suite
  • BOARD
  • CALUMO
  • Carriots Analytics (Envision)
  • Chartio
  • Cyberquery
  • Diver Platform
  • Domo
  • Dundas BI
  • Entrinsik Informer
  • Phocas
  • Sisense
  • Yellowfin BI
  • Zoho Reports
BI-focused products

Besides planning and performance management, BI-focused products target use cases such as standard reporting, ad hoc reporting, analysis, advanced analytics and dashboarding.

  • BI Office Suite
  • BOARD
  • CALUMO
  • Carriots Analytics (Envision)
  • Chartio
  • Cyberquery
  • Diver Platform
  • Domo
  • Dundas BI
  • Entrinsik Informer
  • Phocas
  • Sisense
  • Yellowfin BI
  • Zoho Reports
Enterprise software vendors

Enterprise software vendors have a broad portfolio including most (or all) types of business software.

  • BI Office Suite
  • BOARD
  • CALUMO
  • Carriots Analytics (Envision)
  • Chartio
  • Cyberquery
  • Diver Platform
  • Domo
  • Dundas BI
  • Entrinsik Informer
  • Phocas
  • Sisense
  • Yellowfin BI
  • Zoho Reports
Flexible planning platforms

Flexible planning platforms are most suitable for developing and implementing bespoke planning solutions to meet a unique set of requirements. They usually offer limited predefined content.

  • BI Office Suite
  • BOARD
  • CALUMO
  • Carriots Analytics (Envision)
  • Chartio
  • Cyberquery
  • Diver Platform
  • Domo
  • Dundas BI
  • Entrinsik Informer
  • Phocas
  • Sisense
  • Yellowfin BI
  • Zoho Reports

KPI Explanation
KPIShort explanation
Business benefitsThis KPI is based on the achievement level of a variety of business benefits.
Project successThis KPI is based on the implementation satisfaction level and the frequency of projects completed on time and on budget.
Project lengthThis KPI is based on how quickly the product is implemented.
Business valueThe KPI business value combines the ‘Business benefits’, ‘Project success’ and ‘Project length’ KPIs.
Price-to-valueThis KPI is based on how users rate their BI tool in terms of price-to-value.
RecommendationThis KPI is based on how many users would recommend the product to others.
Vendor supportThis KPI measures user satisfaction with the level of vendor support provided for the product.
Implementer supportThis KPI measures user satisfaction with the level of the implementer’s support for the product.
Product satisfactionThis KPI is based on the frequency of problems encountered with the product.
Customer satisfactionThe KPI customer satisfaction combines the ‘Peice-to-value’, ‘Recommendation’, ‘Product satisfaction’, ‘Vendor support’ and ‘Implementer support’ KPIs.
Self-serviceThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use self-service features with their BI tool.
Flexibility for the userThis KPI is based on how often the product was chosen for its flexibility, and on the frequency of complaints about user flexibility post-implementation.
Ease of useThis KPI is based on how often the product was chosen for its ease of use, and on the level of complaints about ease of use post-implementation.
Sales experienceThis KPI is based on how respondents rate the sales/purchasing experience with the vendor.
Data volumeThis KPI is based on the median volume of data in databases used with the BI tool.
Query performanceThis KPI is based on how quickly queries respond (adjusted by data volume).
Performance satisfactionThis KPI measures the frequency of complaints about the system’s performance.
Customer experienceThe KPI customer satisfaction combines the ‘Ease of use’, ‘Self-service’, ‘Performance satisfaction’, ‘Flexibility for the user’, ‘Data volume’, ‘Query performance’ and ‘Sales experience‘ KPIs.
Cloud BIThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use the product in a cloud environment.
Mobile BIThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use mobile BI with their BI tool.
Operational BIThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use real-time data from transactional systems with their BI tool.
Visual design standardsThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use visual design standards with their BI tool.
Location intelligenceThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use spatial/location analysis with their BI tool.
Visual analysisThis KPI is based on how many sites currently use visual analysis with their BI tool.
Embedded BIThis KPI is based on how many survey respondents use embedded BI.
InnovationThe KPI innovation combines the ‘Embedded BI‘, ‘Cloud BI’, ‘Visual analysis‘, ‘Mobile BI’, ‘Operational BI‘, ‘Location intelligence‘ and ‘Visual design standards’ KPIs to measure the product’s level of innovation.
Considered for purchaseThis KPI is based on whether respondents considered purchasing the product.
Competitive win rateThis KPI is based on the percentage of wins in competitive evaluations.
CompetitivenessThe KPI competitiveness combines the ‘Considered for purchase’ and ‘Competitive win rate’ KPIs.
